    • Method Detail

      • setUserAgentSuffix

        public ADLStoreOptions setUserAgentSuffix​(java.lang.String userAgentSuffix)
        sets the user agent suffix to be added to the User-Agent header in all HTTP requests made to the server. This suffix is appended to the end of the User-Agent string constructed by the SDK.
        Parameters:
        userAgentSuffix - the suffix
        Returns:
        this

      • setInsecureTransport

        public ADLStoreOptions setInsecureTransport​()
        Use http as transport for back-end calls, instead of https. This is to allow unit testing using mock or fake web servers.

        Warning: Do not use this for talking to real Azure Data Lake service, since https is the only supported protocol on the server.

        Returns:
        this

      • enableThrowingRemoteExceptions

        public ADLStoreOptions enableThrowingRemoteExceptions​()
        Throw server-returned exception name instead of ADLExcetption.

        ADLStoreClient methods throw ADLException on failure. ADLException contains additional fields that have details on the error that occurred, like the HTTP response code and the server request ID, etc.

        However, in some cases, server returns an exception name in it's HTTP error stream. Calling this method causes the ADLStoreClient methods to throw the exception name returned by the server rather than ADLException.

        In general, this is not recommended, since the name of the remote exception can also be retrieved from ADLException. This method exists to enable usage within Hadoop as a file system.

        Returns:
        this

      • setFilePathPrefix

        public ADLStoreOptions setFilePathPrefix​(java.lang.String prefix)
        Set a prefix that will be prepended to all file paths from this client. This allows the client to be scoped to a subset of the directory Azure Data Lake Store tree.
        Parameters:
        prefix - String containing the prefix to be prepended
        Returns:
        this

      • setReadAheadQueueDepth

        public ADLStoreOptions setReadAheadQueueDepth​(int queueDepth)
        Sets the default Queue depth to be used for read-aheads in ADLFileInputStream.
        Parameters:
        queueDepth - the desired queue depth, set to 0 to disable read-ahead
        Returns:
        this
